thread.title: Comcast's Internet speed boost goes live: Here's how to activate it
thread.title_full: Comcast's Internet speed boost goes live: Here's how to activate it | OregonLive.com

author: Mike Rogoway | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Comcast's Internet speed boost goes live: Here's how to activate it
text:
Comcast boosted its Internet speeds for many Oregon customers Tuesday morning by 50 percent, but you need to reset your modem to take advantage of it.
The Performance Pro tier went from 50 to 75 megabits per second, and the premium Blast Pro service jumped from 105 to 150 Mbps. Other speed tiers, including other "Performance" tiers, are not changing.
The higher speeds are only available to Comcast customers who subscribe to a bundle of services , or to new customers who subscribe to the new service tiers.
Some modems have a reset button, but Comcast suggests unplugging it for 10 seconds. The faster speeds should materialize when the modem comes back.
Want to check your speed? Go to speedtest.net before resetting your modem, and revisit the site afterward.
Rates for many Comcast cable TV and Internet plans went up at the start of the month .
Comcast charges new, Internet-only subscribers $75 a month for the 75 Mbps service, or $90 for 150 Mbps.
The company's rate structure is extremely complex, and Comcast says there is no standard pricing for the new speeds for customers who subscribe to a bundle of services.
-- Mike Rogoway mrogoway@oregonian.com
